title: Research on Laszlo Moholy Nagy
content:
i need some help that topic.... do u know... where i can find some of Moholy-Nagy advertisement samples....   
   
and what are some of the typefaces that have the Bauhaus look,,,...
author: ngoc723

comments.content: [The Foundry](http://web.archive.org/web/20131019131632/http:/www.thefoundrystudio.co.uk/) has a few collections that they call Architype that I'm thinking about. Especially the Bayer Architype obviously.
A [google](http://web.archive.org/web/20131019131632/http:/www.google.com/search?q=laszlo%2Bmoholy%2Bnagy&ie=UTF-8&oe=UTF-8) search shows at least 10 pages of potential links.
i tried google...... and i can't find any ad sample that he did.....
How about this book: Montage and Modern Life: 1919-1942 edited by Matthew Teitelbaum (MIT Press, 1992)

[http://www.moholy-nagy.com/](http://web.archive.org/web/20131019131632/http:/www.moholy-nagy.com/) There are some samples on the site. It also lists where the archives can be found as well as a contact in regards to archives and research.
And it's a very nice site too.
